html:
** Shares of payments card firm V.N rise as much as 1% to $216.84, snapping a two-day losing streak

** Stock last up 0.5% at $215.695 and top gainer on Dow Jones Industrial Average .DJI

** Amazon AMZN.O said on Monday it would not stop accepting UK-issued Visa Inc credit cards on its British website from Jan. 19 as it had proposed and is working with co to resolve a dispute over payment fees (Full Story)

** AMZN said on Nov. 17 it would ban V's card because of the high transaction fees charged by the payment processor, sending V's shares down by 4.7% (Full Story)

** AMZN was also considering dropping Visa as partner on its U.S. co-branded credit card (Full Story)

** 36 of 39 brokerages rate the stock "buy" or higher and 3 "hold"; their median PT is $275 - Refinitiv data

** As of last close, stock down 0.9% as compared to 2.7% fall in S&P 500 index .SPX


(Reporting by Devik Jain in Bengaluru)

(( Devik.Jain@thomsonreuters.com ; within U.S. +1 646 223 8780; outside U.S. +91 80 6182 2062; ;))
